name: Occidental Grand Xcaret & Royal Club

reviews.title: Great Vacation at the Grand Xcaret!
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I (both in our late 20s) stayed at the Grand Xcaret Occidental from Aug. 27 - Sept. 03. The Grand Xcaret is a quality resort and I recommend it to anyone who is thinking about an
all-inclusive trip to Mexico.
reviews.title: Fabulous Resort
A great vacation to remember!
reviews.text: The grounds of the Grand Xcaret are huge. We did a lot of walking during our stay but we really didn't mind at all. The grounds are gorgeous and you can tell the staff works really hard to maintain everything. Bugs were not an issue at all, although I did notice a few spots by the pool area where the ant population seemed to increase. We had to switch our lounge chairs by the pool only once because of the ant problem.

reviews.title: Wonderful Resort
reviews.text: I thought the quality of food at the resort was really good. For breakfast, we ate at the Beach Club buffet and main buffet. Both were enjoyable. They serve the same food, but the ocean view at the Beach Club is fantastic. We ate at the main buffet and snack bar area above the main pool for lunch. The quality of food is better at the main

reviews.title: FANTASTIC TIME - DON'T BE PUT OFF!
reviews.text: buffet, but the snack bar area is great if you miss the 4 pm deadline for eating lunch at the main

reviews.title: Good time in Grand Xcaret
reviews.text: My wife and 4 yr old wen to this resort for a short trip Aug 28, 04-Sep 2, 04.

reviews.title: Worst Night mare ever (Jason vs Freddy)
reviews.text: I'll provide the basics, write me if you want more specific info.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: Take a taxi to the resort. It costs $62US. Taking the shuttle bus if $18 per person. They didn't charge kids. However, they made about 5 stops on the way. We were the last stop. It took about 1.5 hours of driving, with all the stops. It took 30minutes to wait for them to gather enough people to start the trip. Not worth it. Taxi is best. The taxi fare back to the airport is $40. From what I understand, it's more expensive going out of the airport due to aiport taxes. The resort is big and it was about 1/2 occupied, as most people returned home for school time. It was great. Plan on doing some walking. they offer a golf cart type shuttle service but you have to wait about 5-10 minutes for it to arrive. We used it to get to and from the beach. The swimmable beach is great for kids. They even rent you snorkel gear for free, to use on the property only. It's not a big beach by any means, but it was perfect for us due to our 4 yr old. Very calm water. The swimming pool is pretty large but is not connected to each other. I think they have 3 large pools. One being the largest and main pool. They offer free floating tubes(donut kind). Bring the bed floaties, if that's the kind you like. We stayed in bldg 20. Building 19 and 20 are the most central to the resort. Equal distance from the restaurants/lobby and the beach. Also, it is the closest to the swimming pools. The rooms are just rooms. They're clean and well stocked with cold drinks. What more can you ask for. If you want great rooms you need to go to the Moon Palace. We did the buffet every night, because we have a 4 yr old and waiting for food to arrive just wasn't in the game plan. Also, I 'm on vacation and I am not going to wear long pants in the hot, humid tropical weather. Paco's Tacos doesn't require a reservation and it's pretty good. The buffet food is 3 out of 5. It could have been better. We've been to Moon Palace 2x and Dominican Republic 2x. All were all-inclusives and I would have to say that this place probably had the best food (which isn't saying all that much). I just can't understand why cruise ship chefs can make such good food in mass quantities, but all-inclusive places can't come even close. It's a quandry. The free pass to Xcaret was fun. The underground river swim was fun. The water is extremely cold. The night show is worth watching, so come back for the show. It's literally a 5-7 minute walk to the Xcaret entrance from the resort. Very close. We rented the snorkel gear at Xcaret for $10 but it was not necessary. The entertainment at nights were pretty decent and probably the best out of all the resorts that I've been to. The singer and the band are very good. She sounds exactly live Melissa Etheridge. The Latin Explosion show was great. All the other evening shows were just OK. the people are friendly and helpful. I would go back. The only two things they could change to make it better is: 1) Better food, 2) More frequent shuttle service.

reviews.title: I was in Paradise
reviews.text: Overall we had a great time.

reviews.title: It's hot. Gorgeous.
reviews.text: As an advice, If you are from Miami do not buy any type of packages from All star vacation marketing group located in Brickell Ave.

reviews.title: A Pleasant Vacation
reviews.text: Visited 11/29 to 12/6/03. This is a large resort--from the lobby to the beach area is about a 15 minute walk. We were in building 18 which was a good location-close to main pool, towel shack and restaurants. They do have tram service. Pool temp was VERY refeshing--actually pretty cold--and I do not say that very often. Weather was fickle--nice, clear mornings but intermittent clouds in the afternoons-but surprisingly not humid! Brochures listed Mediterranean restaurant but that was the same as the Italian (same menu). Was able to make 4 dinner reservations on the same day without a long wait. Did not eat at the Oriental or Seafood restaurant. Seafood restaurant is down by the beach-so take the tram-it's somewhat dark at night. Other restaurants were good but portions not that great--much better variety of appetizers and desserts at the Iberostar hotels--and this includes the buffet restaurant--but unless someone is very picky, you could always find plenty to eat. One plus is that the buffet restaurant has AC as do the other restaurants although it was hot in the Mexican restaurant. There was occasionally a smell from the lobby river but nothing too terrible. Rooms are a good size and clean- no problems with towels. Some annoyances were: 1) toilet paper holder was installed about 8 inches from the floor 2)worlds smallest garbage cans with a flip up top in the bathrooms and 3) hair dryer switch had to be held constantly--no on/off switch--slightly frustrating when you have thick hair and it takes about ten minutes to dry it!! Fridge was restocked every day. Resort was a 50 minute drive from the airport (via "limo" service) so longer if on a bus stopping at different resorts along the way. Staff were friendly in all areas. Went to the Xcaret park nightly show--over 2 hours long--very entertaining and colorful. Nightly shows at the resort were good. Beach area is small and manmade with plenty of palapas and loungers. All-in-all a nice resort.

reviews.title: idependent relaxation, great time
reviews.text: My husband and I are independant travelers and loved this resort. The only negatives were when we arrived we didn't have a porter take our luggage to the room so we did it ourselves and didn't figure out the room key turned on the electricity but soon called the front desk and received the info. We also noticed a bad smell on occasion on returning to our room at night. Otherwise we enjoyed the restaurants and the staff was friendly. I loved the calm waters at the beach and the salt water pool for adults only. The hammocks were relaxing after a meal and the bar with the swings ( instead of stools) was delightful. Don't miss the Xcaret Park and the river swim, the nightly Mayan Show. We went back another day and were only charged $20.00 per person ( the 1st day was free) The beach there is very nice also. We have traveled a lot and this was the best resort we have stayed at for the $ and it is very real in the middle of the jungle. We returned Dec 4 to a NY area snowstorm after 85 F. for a week.

reviews.title: beware of car rental at xcaret resort
reviews.text: We returned the day after Thanksgiving Day. Had a wonderful time, weather is perfect this time of year around 80-85 degrees. Rooms were spacious , grounds were magnificent and very grand, people were very friendly and helpful, food was average for Mexico, beach for me was Great, no big waves or under tow just beautiful carribean water...with lots of fish to see snorkeling, plenty of beach chairs, definitely a 5 star hotel compared to other hotels/resorts along the playa del carmen strip ...this hotel is 1st class. our only problem was that we rented a car from Fiesta Car Rental in the resort and found out a little too late that the car had NO BRAKES!!!! we pulled over at a gas station and they came with a 2nd car for us, that car had foot brakes but no emergency brake, we didn't get in that car either and decided to take a cab back to the resort which cost us $12.00 which we were not reimbursed for we did receive out money back for the car rental which was $70.00 for the day. the cars are run down, beat up cars with no gas in them, they are all stick shifts and are not worth the money go elsewhere for a rental.....

reviews.title: I would go back in a second!
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed a week at this beautiful resort, November 15-22, 2003. We arrived at the hotel at 10:00 p.m. so check-in was a breeze. Our room was in Building 20 on the third floor which we didn't mind (the stairs) at all. It was maybe a five minute walk, if that, from the lobby. The resort is big but not as bad as some people made it sound. I quite enjoyed all the exercise I was getting.

reviews.title: Awesome time
reviews.text: Our room was a standard double room and was very nice. There is ample closet space. We had no problems with our security box. We left the maid 20 pesos every day and she restocked our minibar every day and left us towel animals. We always had plenty of towels. When we first arrived at our room we noticed that the toilet seat was broken and it was fixed the next day.

No complaints from this Glaswegian family of four!!!!!!! Spent two weeks at the Occidental Grand Flamenco Xcaret from 21 June to 5 July 2007. Having read some of the negative reviews on here, prior to our holiday, we were a bit apprehensive about what exactly to expect. Within 24 hours of arriving, we realised that those writing negative reviews of this hotel complex must be extremely hard to please!!!
reviews.title: No complaints. Fantastic holiday!!

reviews.text: From check-in to check-out, the staff were nothing but courteous, hard-working and extremely friendly. From the bellboys to the management, the staff at this complex could have done nothing more to ensure our stay was perfect.
reviews.title: Cant wait to go back!

likes.liked: — Food, staff, resort grounds, and wildlife

reviews.text: We had two rooms in block 16. Prior to arrival we emailed the hotel asking for two rooms in the same block, if possible and got exactly as we asked for. Our teenage boys had an adequate room, if a little dull due to trees outside their balcony and our own room was perfect. The beds were ‘firm’, not hard as many have commented but very comfortable. The fridge was stocked daily for a dollar tip, per room, a day. The rooms were kept immaculately clean by the maids, the towels and bed linen were pristine!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, wonderful time!
Our wonderful wedding
reviews.text: The various pools on the complex were excellent, suiting both the active and those wanting to relax. The beach was, indeed, small but ‘picture perfect’ and ample as it is set out on three levels with plenty of room for everyone. Adults and children loved snorkelling amongst the tropical fish.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to keep in touch with the outside world, take advantage of the internet service available via the television in your room. It costs $20 for your whole stay. We found out about this after our first week and found it to be worth the money.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth!

likes.liked: — High quality food/drink, attentive and friendly service by every single person in the hotel
likes.disliked: — in room internet service didn't work half the time

reviews.title: The Grand Flamenco exceeded our expectations!
reviews.text: My wife, two children (13 & 10) and I just spent 5 wonderful days at the Grand Flamenco Xcaret. We all would definitely return. As for the points made by others in their reviews, pretty much all true. But what those reviews didn t give me is any type of perspective that was useful to me. I will attempt to do that here.Smell: Upon rare occasion we did notice a smell from the river. But the odor is very mild, and as I said rare. Perspective: Most of New York s Manhattan Island or San Francisco s China town have much stronger, much more prevalent smells and remember these cities are loved by millions. (I won't go into details about Venice Italy.)Expansive Grounds require walking: True. Perspective: Nothing compared to a trip to Las Vegas. I frequently travel to Las Vegas and usually stay at one of the major casinos. A walk through Caesars Palace or from your room to the pool at Mandalay Bay seems farther, and much, much more confusing than getting around the Grand Flamenco.Friendly Staff: We found the staff to be very friendly to anyone that was even remotely reasonable. We also witnessed a woman from New Jersey have a fit and was yelling because something wasn t to her liking. The staff still managed a smile, but dealt with her as kindly as possible. My kids were appalled. If she had tried that in any New York hotel, she would have gotten a very different response!I think you get the picture. My wife, kids and I didn t want to leave.Some other information I would have liked to have before our visit: -The Xcaret park is only about one long city block walk from the hotel restaurant area so you can visit the park and return for dinner before the evening show. -Take a taxi from the airport. Even the small shuttles stop a lot and hence eat up a lot of time and the cost is almost identical! - The worst exchange rate we found was at the Cancun Airport. Change your money anywhere but the Airport.

reviews.title: The Best Resort- wonderful customer service
reviews.text: Unbelievable resort- would go back in a "Mexican Moment". The staff was extemely friendly, went out of their way to ensure you had clean rooms, drinks, great food. Spa has the hot jacuzzi- the pools were cool, they also had jacuzzis, but were chilly. No kayaking or windsurfing or other usual unmotorized beach activites. Activities and shows every day, newsletter every day for the guests. We made reservations for the specialty restaurants, but never used them- Le Buffet was fabulous every night. Breakfast only available at Le Buffet or the Beach club by the ocean- both excellent. Lunches at those same, excellent selections.

reviews.title: Honeymoon Gone Bad!!!
reviews.text: Christmas Eve was unlimited grilled lobster tails, giant shrimp, lots of seafood, unbelievable dessert bar. Champagne to greet the guests that night. The place is HUGE- take shuttles, they go around every few minutes, even if you are in very good shape. Lots of walking, we thought that was great. It is a small beach, but if the ocean is calm, snorkel the reef right next to the adult swimming area- right behind the Beach Club. We went to the Xcaret park several days, worth the extra cash. My husband took the scuba dive trips, loved them. The parks get full in the afternoon, the mornings are empty- good time to snorkel and explore. Bars are excellent- never have to wait for drinks. We did tip our maid and waiters when we had exceptional service, but they did not act like they expected it. Off the resort, they all expected tips and had big signs indicating this.Taxis tend to speed- take some getting used to- we went to the snorkel tour on the Moromo beach- that is not for the beginner. Quite a current to fight, but fabulous reef, tons of fish- excellent customer service from the staff there. Playa de Carmen was a nightmare to walk thru, hawking their wares. Did not care for that experience. The Grand Xcaret was top notch- highly recommend it.

reviews.title: Great vacation
reviews.text: My husband and I went on our honeymoon and stayed at this resort. We were promised honeymoon accomidations with a king bed and a view of the pools on the resort. When we arrived, the hotel had put us in a room with two double beds and a view of a road. After spending the rest of the day trying to reason with the front desk, we still ended up with the same room. The beds are hard, linens and pillows smelled like mold, the maid service woke you up at five in the morning slaming doors and yelling down the hallway to each other while they cleaned seperate rooms. The next morning was a Monday and called my travel agent and explained the situation. The travel agent said she would call and take care of the situation. We were moved to a room right next door with the same view but a rock hard king bed. By now the front desk was familiar with my husband and I and never answered the front desk phone when we would call to try to get extra cusioning for the bed, clean linens and pillows. I soon found out the front desk had caller ID and this was why they would not answer the phone when we called. This hotel treated my husband and I like they did not care and made no attempt to put us in the room I was promised from the beginning. I would not reccomend this resort to my worst enemy!

reviews.title: A Perfect Honeymoon
reviews.text: A large group of us (22) traveled to The Grand Flamenco a week ago. We had an exceptionally good time. The hotel staff is more than accomodating. The facilitities are nice, and the food is great. My only complaint is the distance from one end of the resort to another, but they run a shuttle service that circles the resort.

reviews.title: total awesome
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned this week Nov17/03 from a total awesome holiday the staff at the hotel did everything possible to make our holiday complete and their memory was excellent remembering our faces and asking if everything was okay. The walking can be a little much for some but not for myself as that my excercise each day from to many Tequile's. And as for the park Xcaret it is difficult to put into words how fanatastic it was I have never experienced any so incredible in my life it would have to be rate a 10+. The tour guides from Lomas Travel that took us to Chichen Itza to see the ruins were also extremely helpful and informative Victor our tour guide was also a little humorous at times as well which made the long trip well worth the day spent travelling inland. My husband and myself are already planning our trip for next year. Please note I have never seen a Resort so clean and manicured like this. I have no complaints what so ever, so try it I am sure you will also enjoy.

reviews.title: Glorious Place
reviews.text: I read the reviews after I had booked and was actually dreading the holiday. How misguided was I? We had a 11 hour flight from England and arrived late evening. We were directed to our room that was in the furthest building apart from the Club rooms and it was about a 10 minute walk. But a 10 minute walk through beautiful landscaped gardens.

reviews.title: Grand Flamenco Xcaret is Grand
reviews.text: Our luggage arrived by golf cart shortly after and the rooms were lovely. Large, modern and with every amenity. To respond to the negative points mentioned on this site: There were moments when we were walking when we smelt drains but it was only brief and you are in the middle of Mexico not London for goodness sake. The hotel is well spread out and was not full when we were there (End Oct 03) but unless you are seriously lazy it will not bother you - nothing is more than 10 minutes away and there are golf carts sporadically collecting people along the journey if you are. The food was wonderful, from the breakfasts to the main buffet lunch to the specialist restaurants. We booked 4 restaurants on day one (with no queues or availability issues I add) for our 1 week stay and went to all but the seafood one. Each one was different and lovely. The pools were empty and I stress the second pool is by far the nicer and it even has waiter service when it is quiet. We are not into laid on entertainment so I cant comment on the quality but imagine it is pretty standard across the Caribbean. The beach was small and manmade - but beautiful. We are pool people so only wandered down for a look and it was also deserted. We didnt use any of the restaurants by the beach so can't comment on them. I filled in the questionnaire for the hotel before I left and the only negatives were: the lighting in the bedrooms is far too dim, (dont try putting a contact lens in at any stage!), and the service in the lobby bar was painfully slow but had we really needed another drink we could have got off our bottoms and gone to the bar ourselves! Maybe they were trying to tell us we had had enough already. In summary we had the best holiday we have ever had, and having travelled the globe from Sun City to Slovenia I reckon I have a little experience. It is in fact the only hotel I have ever stayed in that I would return to as I normally think life is too short. It did exactly what it said on the tin: luxury, fabulous mango margaritas, good food and plenty of sunshine. Bliss. ps.

reviews.title: Dont read the lies
reviews.text: It is loads better than the Riu Yucutan where I have stayed before!

reviews.title: Best Resort I've Been to :)
reviews.text: We just returned from the Grand Flamenco , stayed 10/31/03-11/7/03, and have nothing but great things to say. We were a little concerned due to dome poor reviews but were extremly pleased with ou stay. Couple of notes: 1) check in was fabulous - we had requested a poolside room on the 2nd floor , we stayed in Flamenco 20 building and got exactly what we requested. The front desk staff was excellent - they showed us to our room as well as several other staff helped direct us. 2) the resort is beautiful - yes it is large and there is a ot of walking - but it is well worth the walk - there are even deer in the middle of this resort, 3) the pools are large and always had room , 4) the beach is small and not really a good beach but we knew that coming in and found that we enjoyed the small beach and the bar. Dont book here if you are looking for a large beach its not here. Note - ask the lifeguard to take you out snorkeling outside the roped in area - great snorkeling. 5) food - adequate , typical buffet style all inclusive food. Ala carte was ok - lots of availablility , we would recommend the seafood restaurant you can order lobster tail at an extra price but it made our evening, 6) room was clean and quite nice , liked coffee maker as well deck.

The Occidental Grand Xcaret is a great resort, for both couples and families. The complex is huge and it has a superior structure. There are many restaurants (7 I think) and they are all good, not excellent though. The service is excellent. The bedrooms aren't the best, but they are fine. The beach area is small. The hotel is right next to the Xcaret park, you can walk to the park from the resort.
reviews.title: Great resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I certainly recommend this resort!
reviews.title: *** or ****
Great Resort for a Bargain Price
reviews.text: Resort Review

My wife and I just returned from Occidental (Xcaret) (6-28/7-5). I read many negative reviews prior to our arrival. Frankly, I went in looking for problems. At the conclusion of day one we both said this as a solid 3 star AI resort. By the last day we had changed our opinion and rate it a solid 4 star. Last summer we vacationed at Barceló Maya Riviera (Tropical) and loved it. We’ve also stayed at the Riu and the Palace resorts. All have been good and I’d rate Occidental on par with those resorts however the Tropical is our favorite. The staff at Occidental could not have been better. They were always friendly and anxious to serve. I do think the resort may have been a little understaffed. These lush jungle resorts are a lot more labor intensive than those in Cancun. Our room was kept spotless as was the main buildings.
reviews.title: Good margaritas, nice beach, so-so food

reviews.text: Suggestions: We stayed in building 20 on the third floor. I’d highly recommend 20. We met another couple who stayed in 17 and complained about a mildew smell.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay
Terrific time!
reviews.text: I'll try not to be too long-winded. First, I've been reading the reviews here at Tripadvisor for a while, now, and I sometimes wonderis everyone writing about the same hotel? How can some people thoroughly despise a property that other people thoroughly love? Isn't everyone getting the same rooms, food, etc.? Well, I've figured it out, I think. A bad experience, especially a really bad experience, will cast a pall over an entire vacation. Suddenly, food that was good becomes food that was bad. Rooms become small and EVERYONE was rude and incompetent. Now, that said, on with my own review of the Xcaret.

reviews.title: Best Family Vacation
reviews.text: There is almost nothing horribly wrong with this hotel. Dark rooms? Yes, they are a bit dark, but that's certainly no big deal. Smell? Just a little bit, now and then. It might bother you for a moment or two, but goes away if you quit dwelling on it. Beach? Yeah, I have to agree that the beach is rather dismal, but with these great pools it doesn't matter much. Food? It varied from really good to pretty bad. We stayed at this hotel from 8/15 to 8/22. For some reason, on Saturday, nothing was any good that we ate. Of course, there are probably those who loved it. Just a matter of personal opinion and individual taste buds.

reviews.title: A balanced view
reviews.text: We would like to have done much more, but we lost two days due to my wife being sick. (A chronic condition - not at all related to Mexico or the hotel.)

reviews.title: Good resort
reviews.text: We did make it to Xcaret park. It was really great, and I thoroughly enjoyed the Sea Trek. We also made it to Playa del Carmen and Cozumel. They were both great for shopping and sightseeing.

reviews.title: Fun Vacation!
reviews.text: The bottom line is that I would go back to the Grand Xcaret in a minute. The only drawback is the beach, but, if that isn't important to you, then you can't do much better than here.

reviews.title: Living Large at Xcaret
reviews.text: Just got back last night from the Grand Flamenco Xcaret. My second trip to Riveria Maya this summer.

reviews.title: grand xcaret is the best vac ....
reviews.text: This is a very LARGE resort, alot of walking! as things are spread out. Fine for my husband and 9 year old son, but not for older people or those with physical disabilities. That said, we had a wonderful time.

reviews.title: fabulous time
reviews.text: The rooms are immaculate and spacious, however I did put a towel on the floor by the door at night to absorb noise (tile floor) as passersby and crying kids woke us early one morning .

reviews.title: Now it's my turn! (very thorough review)
reviews.text: As I had read in other reviews, breakfast and lunch were the best! I thought I had done my research only to find when we got there that men need LONG pants and shoes to get into the "special restaurants". After expressing my dismay, I was told that if we didnt come up with any, the hotel would loan my husband some. So the day of our reservation, he went to guest services and they presented him with a pair of elastic waist, polyester pants, that we folded under. (they were new and clean) they were fine. That evening we ate at the "Beach Club" Seafood restaurant. The atmosphere is to die for, service very good, but the food was lousy. The best meal we had was at the Steak House "Sonora Grill" the filet mignon was perfect.

reviews.title: Great Honeymoon at the Grand Xcaret!
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed going from pool to pool, then to the beach, trying the bars at all of them. The bartenders were great, especially the guys at the swim up pool bar (behind the waterfall!) The drinks were all great, and I think I tried every one on the menu in my 6 nights there. My son enjoyed ordering "Pina Coladas" (no rum).

reviews.title: Blew Us Away Don't Listen to Negative Reviews
reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful. The grounds were absolutely beautiful. The food was excellent - so many freshly made dishes at every meal, about 12 kinds of fresh squeezed juice for breakfast (papaya, guava, cactus, beet, pineapple...). The breakfast buffet by the ocean and the main buffet by the entertainment stage were our favorites. The ceviche was delicious. The beach is not a traditional beach but is a circular shallow lagoon with no tides, white sand, clean water, great for snorkeling or just floating around. The myriad swimming pools were fresh water and always sparkling clean, we don't know how they do it. There were loads of free activities every day -- yoga, pilates, bike tours, aerobics, archery, the list goes on and on. We are a single couple with sophisticated tastes and loved it but I can see how it would be a haven for kids as well. The nightly shows are fun, not cheesy, the park next door is great for the eco-minded. We rented a car at the airport and were able to do several day trips - snorkeling at the stunning beach at Akumal, a trip into Playa del Carmen which also has a stunning beach and beautiful people. Don't listen to the negative reviews unless you are the type of person who wants chicken fingers and pizza breads on the buffet. It's not the Mandarin Oriental but neither is the cost.
June 18th- June 25th We are from NJ...I believe half the guests at the resort this week were from NJ...
reviews.title: Loved this trip

reviews.text: Let me start by saying my husband was not happy when I booked this trip to Mexico!
reviews.title: An all-inclusive Cruise on Land

likes.disliked: — Wish the beds were a tad bit softer.

reviews.text: I booked this trip thru AAA traveling with My husbandand son (17) In the airport in Cancun we headed straight to the American Express booth where a van took us to our resort. (We did not talk to anyone else!!!)
reviews.title: GreatTime...Beautiful Place

reviews.text: At the resort We were greated with a "tropical juice" as we headed to check in. Check in was simple. We were 45 minutes early but our room was ready for us. We went to our room on our own following a map. Not difficult at all. Our bags arrive no more than 10 minutes later. We did not know how to turn on the lights. Being this area is Eco friendly, we just had to put our room key card into a slot as you walk in and the lights come on.
reviews.title: Info. if going with kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I are from Long Island, NY and we stayed at the Occidential Grand Xcaret the last week in May 2007.
reviews.title: Great place for the price!

likes.disliked: — Not much to do at night, and the drinks were obviously watered down.

reviews.text: We took the free shuttle from the airport which was approx. one hour to the hotel. We had no problem checking in. A staff member even walked us to our building # 22 which was far from the reception area. The room was clean, the towels and mini frig was stocked every day. The bathroom was large and the water pressure in the shower was great! Beware of the concierge at the entrance of every building. They are very friendly, but their main goal is to get you to attend a seminar at the Royal Club. I assume it's for timesharing opportunities.
reviews.title: Beautiful Facility, Fabulous Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restort is very large and with a jungle like atmosphere including some animal exhibits. The gardens are beautiful and well manicured.
reviews.title: mixed experience

reviews.text: There are many large pools with more than enough seating for everyone. No need to "save a chair" unless you wanted to be under an umbrella. Waitress service all day long. The pools were very clean.
reviews.title: Fantastico!!!!!

reviews.text: The food was decent (we've had much worse at other all-inclusive resorts). Breakfast was probably the best of the three meals. There are restaurants in addition to the buffet, but you need to make a reservation.
reviews.title: Family Favorite
Truly Amazing!
reviews.text: My friend and I recently visiting the Grand Flamenco Xcaret and we cannot say enough about it. From the breathtaking lush grounds to the food to the service - everything was fabulous. Here's some comments & tips on the things we saw...

reviews.title: Royalty at the Royal Club
reviews.text: RESORT: Truly spectacular. Lush beautiful grounds - immaculate, very clean. Great pools, lots of room & lounge chairs. All of the restaurants were great - the Sonora Grill (steakhouse) was my favourite. Tip: Go the Beach Grill for breakfast! I do not understand why so many people go to the regular buffet, when you could go to the beach grill (same food) and have the most incredible view! All of the staff were wonderful, very friendly and eager to assist. Lots of security - very safe. The spa was wonderful - the massage was great.

reviews.title: Wonderful Winter Holiday
reviews.text: One disappointment for me was that there were no hot tubs on the resort (except one at the spa that closed at 6). It was chilly at night, and a hot tub would have been great. The only other downfall is the nightlife - that is, if this is important to you. The Disco Sucks! No big deal...

reviews.title: We'll be Back!!!!
reviews.text: we just took a cab into town ($8 each way), which was well worth it. If you are looking for nightlife, Senor Frogs & Tutix are a must!

reviews.title: a true paradise!
reviews.text: BEACH: Yes - the reviews about the beach are true. There really is no beach - more like a little lagoon. This did not bother us at all as we were prepared and did not expect a beach front property. Small sacrafice - trust me! It's an $18 roundtrip ferry ride (plus the $8 cab ride into town) to go to Cozumel - definately worth it... great snorkeling. Also, worth it to spend take a cab into town and do the beach in Playa at least once.

description: Tucked within an ecological and historical preserve, the all-inclusive Occidental Grand Xcaret captivates guests with spectacular grounds, a pristine coastline and unparalleled service and amenities. Located less than an hour south of Cancun International Airport and ten minutes from renowned Playa del Carmen, this glorious resort boasts winding river channels, free-form pools and a private beach with powder-soft white sand on a quiet cove. The Occidental Grand Xcaret features eleven international restaurants and ten bars to fit every mood and occasion, from a romantic dinner to a lively family meal.
